Значения

Доска; табличка; номер. Торговая марка; торговый знак; бренд. Игральные карты; игральные кости

humanum_full_description_en:
From the " sheet ", " humble " sound, symbol, or representation made by the notice board. Tang Gu Shenzi "Bo Yizhi‧ Yin Yin Ke": "Before the trip, I saw the sign on the sign saying "Tiangui Mountain Palace", written in silver."

" Paper " can mean the household registration board. "Guangya·Shiqi": "Reed card, registration." "Song History·Bingzhi Sixth": "Those who have been insured from outside will receive the same insurance. If the number of households is sufficient, they will be attached. Don’t be a guarantee, place a card to write down the name of the household.”

" Card " can mean a certificate. Tang Wangjian "Gift to General Hu Zheng": "The official deed is divided on the vermilion card, and the emperor is held by the yellow paper head."

" Card " also refers to a shield. Song Meng Yuan veteran "Tokyo Menghualu·Driving in Baojin Tower and the Army Shows a Hundreds of Plays": "Five or seven pairs of appearances, or use guns against cards, swords against cards, etc."

" Pai " was also used as a metal currency in the Southern Song Dynasty. Song Wu Zimu's "Menglianglu-City Money Meeting": "Because of the impunity of money laws in the province, Hangzhou added pewter plates for practical use."

The grassroots organization of the Yuan Dynasty army is also called " pai ". "Yuan History‧Bingzhiyi": "Ten people make a card, set the card head, get on the horse to prepare for battle, and get off the horse to gather together for herding."

" Pai " also refers to a card document, which is an official document in the Ming and Qing Dynasties. "The Scholars" Chapter 19: "I took the book from his elder Kuang Da, saying that the grandmaster was in Wenzhou, and the card of Qi Ji had arrived, and he was asked to come back for the exam."

" Pai " also means the name of the song. Qing Liu Xizai's "Arts and Songs-Songs and Songs": "There are brand names in the song sets, and those with the same name but different bodies, and those with the same body but different names."

In modern Chinese, entertainment or gambling equipment made of teeth, bones, and paper are also called " pai ". "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 47: "The cards in Jia Mu Xiao's hand are scattered on the table."

humanum_full_description:
從「片」，「卑」聲，表示做標志或告示用的板。唐谷神子《博異志‧陰隱客》：「行至闕前，見牌上署曰『天桂山宮』，以銀字書之。」

　　「牌」可表示戶籍板。《廣雅‧釋器》：「簧牌，籍也。」 《宋史‧兵志六》：「有自外入保者，收為同保，戶數足則附之，俟及十家，則別為保，置牌以書其戶數姓名。」

　　「牌」可表示憑證。唐王建〈贈胡證將軍〉：「朱牌面上分官契，黃紙頭邊押勅符。」

　　「牌」還指盾牌。宋孟元老《東京夢華錄‧駕登寶津樓諸軍呈百戲》：「出場凡五七對，或以鎗對牌，劍對牌之類。」

　　「牌」也用作南宋的一種金屬貨幣。宋吳自牧《夢粱錄‧都市錢會》：「朝省因錢法不通，杭城增造鑞牌，以便行用。」

　　元代軍隊的基層編制單位也稱為「牌」。《元史‧兵志一》：「十人為一牌，設牌頭，上馬則備戰鬥，下馬則屯聚牧養。」

　　「牌」還指牌文，即明清時一種公文。《儒林外史》第19回：「接了他哥匡大的書子，說宗師按臨溫州，齊集的牌已到，叫他回來應考。」

　　「牌」也表示詞曲的調名。清劉熙載《藝概‧詞曲概》：「曲套中有牌名，有名同而體異者，有體同而名異者。」

　　近現代漢語以牙、骨、紙等製成的娛樂或賭博用具也叫「牌」。《紅樓夢》第47回：「賈母笑的手裏的牌撒了一桌子。」

牌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pái］
［《廣韻》薄佳切，平佳，並。］
［《廣韻》步皆切，平皆，並。］
(1)做标志或告示用的板。
(2)古时官府用作凭证的小木板或金属板。
(3)户籍板。犹今之户口簿。
(4)企业为商品起的专用名称。
(5)南宋的一种金属货币。
(6)元代军队的基层编制单位。
(7)古时军中小头目牌头的简称。
(8)指盾牌。
(9)指时辰。古时用十二地支记十二时辰，官府按时辰挂出牌子。
(10)指牌文。明清时代一种上行下的公文名称。
(11)词曲的调名。
(12)以牙、骨、纸等制成的娱乐或赌博用具。
(13)喻密谋，花招。
(14)通“箄”。木排。

(1) A board used as a sign or notice.

(4) The special name given to the product by the enterprise.
(5) A metal currency in the Southern Song Dynasty.
(6) The basic unit of the army in the Yuan Dynasty.
(7) The abbreviation of Paitou, the small and medium boss of the ancient army.
(8) Refers to the shield.
(9) Refers to time. In ancient times, the twelve earthly branches were used to record the twelve hour, and the government hung up signs according to the hour.
(10) Refers to the card text. The name of an official document in the Ming and Qing Dynasties.
(11) The name of the song.
(12) Entertainment or gambling equipment made of teeth, bones, paper, etc.
(13) Yu plots and tricks.
(14) Through "箄". Wooden raft.
